patterns_discovered.description: Created detailed manual testing guide covering 6 critical verification criteria: touch target compliance, horizontal scroll prevention, mobile navigation, form usability, typography scaling, and console error monitoring
Defined standard viewports (mobile 375px, tablet 768px, desktop 1280px) plus edge cases (320px, 2560px) with specific verification steps for each
Established 44x44px minimum WCAG AAA compliance requirement with specific element checklist including hamburger menus, buttons, inputs, and interactive elements
Documented mobile drawer vs desktop sidebar behavior with detailed resize behavior verification and state management testing
Defined three comprehensive test flows: Mobile First Experience, Responsive Transitions, and Cross-Browser Testing with step-by-step procedures
Included verification of implementation across layout components, theme configuration, UI components, utilities, and pages with quality checks

gotchas_discovered.issue: Contains `console.log('View inspection:', row.id)` placeholder for future implementation
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Marked as acceptable placeholder, should be removed before production

gotchas_discovered.issue: Mobile drawer state must be auto-closed when resizing to desktop view to prevent stuck-open state
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Documented specific resize behavior test to verify drawer auto-closes at 900px breakpoint

gotchas_discovered.issue: Virtual keyboards can obscure input fields on mobile devices
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Included test procedure to verify keyboard doesn't obscure active input, verify scroll behavior

gotchas_discovered.issue: Horizontal scroll can occur from various sources (fixed widths, tables, long text, margin/padding calculations)
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Documented multiple common issues and provided console verification: `document.body.scrollWidth === window.innerWidth`

gotchas_discovered.issue: Responsive components can cause hydration mismatches if not using proper hooks like useMediaQuery
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Listed as unacceptable console error, included verification check in manual testing
